page.title: 03SNAITH
page.content: Snaith is a small town situated next to a major crossing point of the River Aire. It owes its early development to its position on routes linking the Port of Goole and the industrial West Riding. First developments were around St Lawrence's Church. Agricultural links can be inferred through the street names, Beast Fair, Market Place, Butt Lane. The centre of the town contains many listed buildings, most notable of which are the old 'LOCK UPS'. These are presently under threat from development. The Town Council however wishes that the structure be maintained and incorporated into a wall of architectural interest.
